title: Signal: SIGSEGV (Segmentation fault) when starting up on gdb using Clion

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
use devourer::channels::channel::Channel;
use std::net::{SocketAddr, UdpSocket};
struct Test {
    sock: UdpSocket,
}

impl Test {
    pub fn tuck(_: i32) -> Test { unimplemented!() }
}

fn main() { let test = Test::tuck(666); }
```
The whole program is very complicated and I can't put it here.
I was expecting it to panic. However, when I run in debug mode in Clion, it gave Signal: SIGSEGV (Segmentation fault) when starting up.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33482468/94530446-b10c5b80-026d-11eb-948e-52d156bf5588.png)
```log
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff7fee6da in strcmp () from /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2
```
It is the minimal version of it and I'm not sure what caused it to crash. If I edit any of these lines, it will work again. (I can't do this in real code)

This happens only on my PC. I have tried on my laptop and it was fine. I have tried several versions of gdb and rust. They didn't make a difference.

Moreover, it will run with gdb from the terminal.
